taglib.description: JSF-Flex goal is to provide users capability in creating Flex components as JSF components. So users would create the components as normal JSF components and the contribution will create the necessary SWF files and etcetera and link the values of the components back to the managed beans using JSON+Javascript and Actionscript.

tag.name: flexAttributeNode
tag.description: In order to simplify development and focus in bridging of JSF and Flex, all attributes of a component that is not specific to the JSF Flex project and not boundable to a bean will be provided as a sub-tag of the component. Meaning one can consider the component to be an XML Element node and this tag/component to be an Attribute node.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Attribute name.

attribute.name: value
attribute.description: Attribute value.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: Get a string which uniquely identifies this UIComponent within the scope of the nearest ancestor NamingContainer component. The id is not necessarily unique across all components in the current view.

attribute.name: rendered
attribute.description: A boolean value that indicates whether this component should be rendered. Default value: true.

attribute.name: binding
attribute.description: Identifies a backing bean property (of type UIComponent or appropriate subclass) to bind to this component instance. This value must be an EL expression.

attribute.name: componentNameSpace
attribute.description: Component's NameSpace.

attribute.name: componentAttributes
attribute.description: Map of attribute names provided as keys and values provided as values.

attribute.name: componentName
attribute.description: Component's name.

attribute.name: componentAttributesJSONFormat
attribute.description: Component attributes provided in JSON Format.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: Get a string which uniquely identifies this UIComponent within the scope of the nearest ancestor NamingContainer component. The id is not necessarily unique across all components in the current view.

attribute.name: rendered
attribute.description: A boolean value that indicates whether this component should be rendered. Default value: true.

attribute.name: binding
attribute.description: Identifies a backing bean property (of type UIComponent or appropriate subclass) to bind to this component instance. This value must be an EL expression.

attribute.name: mxmlPackageName
attribute.description: The mxmlPackageName for the application.

attribute.name: providedAdditionalXmlnsMap
attribute.description: Additional xmlns in form of key/value where key is the prefix and the value being the url.

attribute.name: sourcePath
attribute.description: This value will be passed to the mxmlc compiler when creating a SWF. It must be an absolutePath to a filesystem where additional ActionScript and MXML files that are needed for the current SWF generation are located at.

attribute.name: providedAdditionalExternalLibaryPath
attribute.description: This value represents Collection of additional SWC files. For instance, if one wishes to use additional open source projects or self projects that is archived as a SWC file, JSF Flex will unzip those files and place them within the same directory that JSF Flex's SWC file is extracted to to create links for the to be created SWF file.

attribute.name: defaultBgColor
attribute.description: This value will be passed to the mxmlc compiler when creating a SWF. It represents the defaultBgColor, surprise.

attribute.name: maxLvRecursion
attribute.description: This value will be passed to the mxmlc compiler when creating a SWF. It represents the max level of recursion that the Flash VM will allow.

attribute.name: maxScriptExecTime
attribute.description: This value will be passed to the mxmlc compiler when creating a SWF. It represents the max script exec time that the Flash VM will allow.

attribute.name: incremental
attribute.description: This value will be passed to the mxmlc compiler when creating a SWF. It represents whether the creation of the SWF files will based incrementally.

attribute.name: loadConfig
attribute.description: This value will be passed to the mxmlc compiler when creating a SWF. It should bean absolutePath to a loadConfig XML file that specifies attributes for the mxmlc.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: This value will be passed to the mxmlc compiler when creating a SWF. It simply is a metadata for the SWF.

attribute.name: creator
attribute.description: This value will be passed to the mxmlc compiler when creating a SWF. It simply is a metadata for the SWF.

attribute.name: publisher
attribute.description: This value will be passed to the mxmlc compiler when creating a SWF. It simply is a metadata for the SWF.

attribute.name: language
attribute.description: This value will be passed to the mxmlc compiler when creating a SWF. It simply is a metadata for the SWF.

attribute.name: date
attribute.description: This value will be passed to the mxmlc compiler when creating a SWF. It simply is a metadata for the SWF.

attribute.name: errorColor
attribute.description: Color of text for the error component. The default value is 0x0B333C.

attribute.name: errorFontAntiAliasType
attribute.description: Sets the antiAliasType property of internal TextFields for the error component. Possible values are normal and advanced.

attribute.name: errorFontFamily
attribute.description: Name of the font to use for the error component. The default value is Verdana.

attribute.name: errorFontGridFitType
attribute.description: Sets the gridFitType property of internal TextFields for the error component that represent text in Flex controls. The possible values are none, pixel, and subpixel.

attribute.name: errorFontSharpness
attribute.description: Sets the sharpness property of internal TextFields for the error component that represent text in Flex controls. This property specifies the sharpness of the glyph edges. The possible values are Numbers from -400 through 400.

attribute.name: errorFontSize
attribute.description: Height of the text for the error component, in pixels. The default value is 10.

attribute.name: errorFontStyle
attribute.description: Determines whether the text for the error component is italic font. Recognized values are normal and italic.

attribute.name: errorFontThickness
attribute.description: Sets the thickness property of internal TextFields for the error component that represent text in Flex controls. This property specifies the thickness of the glyph edges. The possible values are Numbers from -200 to 200.

attribute.name: errorFontWeight
attribute.description: Determines whether the text for the error component is boldface. Recognized values are normal and bold.

attribute.name: errorPaddingLeft
attribute.description: Number of pixels between the error component's container's left border and the left edge of its content area.

attribute.name: errorPaddingRight
attribute.description: Number of pixels between the error component's container's right border and the right edge of its content area.

attribute.name: errorTextAlign
attribute.description: Alignment of text for the error component within a container. Possible values are left, right, or center.

attribute.name: errorTextDecoration
attribute.description: Determines whether the text for the error component is underlined. Possible values are none and underline.

attribute.name: errorTextIndent
attribute.description: Offset of first line of text for the error component from the left side of the container, in pixels.

attribute.name: title
attribute.description: Title or caption displayed in the title bar.

attribute.name: componentAttributes
attribute.description: Map of attribute names provided as keys and values provided as values.

attribute.name: componentAttributesJSONFormat
attribute.description: Component attributes provided in JSON Format.

attribute.name: action
attribute.description:
The action to take when this command is invoked.

If the value is an expression, it is expected to be a method binding EL expression that identifies an action method. An action method accepts no parameters and has a String return value, called the action outcome, that identifies the next view displayed. The phase that this event is fired in can be controlled via the immediate attribute.

If the value is a string literal, it is treated as a navigation outcome for the current view. This is functionally equivalent to a reference to an action method that returns the string literal.

attribute.name: actionListener
attribute.description: A method binding EL expression that identifies an action listener method to be invoked if this component is activated by the user. An action listener method accepts a parameter of type javax.faces.event.ActionEvent and returns void. The phase that this event is fired in can be controlled via the immediate attribute.

attribute.name: immediate
attribute.description: A boolean value that identifies the phase during which action events should fire. During normal event processing, action methods and action listener methods are fired during the "invoke application" phase of request processing. If this attribute is set to "true", these methods are fired instead at the end of the "apply request values" phase.

If this attribute is set to true, these methods are fired instead at the end of the apply request values phase.

attribute.name: required
attribute.description: A boolean value that indicates whether an input value is required. If this value is true, and no input value is provided, the error message javax.faces.component.UIInput.REQUIRED is posted.

attribute.name: validator
attribute.description: A method binding EL expression, accepting FacesContext, UIComponent, and Object parameters, and returning void, that validates the component's local value.

attribute.name: valueChangeListener
attribute.description: A method binding EL expression, accepting a ValueChangeEvent parameter and returning void. The specified method is invoked if this component is modified. The phase that this handler is fired in can be controlled via the immediate attribute.

attribute.name: converter
attribute.description: The value can either be a static value (ID) or an EL expression. When a static id is specified, an instance of the converter type registered with that id is used. When this is an EL expression, the result of evaluating the expression must be an object that implements the Converter interface.

attribute.name: converterMessage
attribute.description: Text to be displayed to the user as an error message when conversion of a submitted value to the target type fails.

attribute.name: requiredMessage
attribute.description: Text to be displayed to the user as an error message when this component is marked as "required" but no input data is present during a postback (ie the user left the required field blank).

attribute.name: validatorMessage
attribute.description: Text which will be shown if validation fails.

tag.name: flexComboBox
tag.description:
AbstractFlexUIComboBox is a special case where the preserving of the state of the "text" field
is held within the code. Main reason is because it extends FlexUISelectedIndexBase and there exists
no reason to create an another base class to preserve both "selectedIndex" + "text".

attribute.description: A method binding EL expression, accepting a ValueChangeEvent parameter and returning void. The specified method is invoked if this component is modified. The phase that this handler is fired in can be controlled via the immediate attribute.

attribute.name: converter
attribute.description: The value can either be a static value (ID) or an EL expression. When a static id is specified, an instance of the converter type registered with that id is used. When this is an EL expression, the result of evaluating the expression must be an object that implements the Converter interface.

attribute.name: action
attribute.description:
The action to take when this command is invoked.

If the value is an expression, it is expected to be a method binding EL expression that identifies an action method. An action method accepts no parameters and has a String return value, called the action outcome, that identifies the next view displayed. The phase that this event is fired in can be controlled via the immediate attribute.

If the value is a string literal, it is treated as a navigation outcome for the current view. This is functionally equivalent to a reference to an action method that returns the string literal.

attribute.name: actionListener
attribute.description: A method binding EL expression that identifies an action listener method to be invoked if this component is activated by the user. An action listener method accepts a parameter of type javax.faces.event.ActionEvent and returns void. The phase that this event is fired in can be controlled via the immediate attribute.

attribute.name: immediate
attribute.description: A boolean value that identifies the phase during which action events should fire. During normal event processing, action methods and action listener methods are fired during the "invoke application" phase of request processing. If this attribute is set to "true", these methods are fired instead at the end of the "apply request values" phase.

tag.name: flexProgressBar
tag.description:
Note though FlexUIProgressBar extends AbstractFlexUIValueBase, it will simply retrieve the value during the post-back phase
and NOT set the field of the Flex component as this field is read only.

attribute.name: groupName
attribute.description: Specifies the name of the group to which this RadioButton control belongs, or specifies the value of the id property of a RadioButtonGroup control if this RadioButton is part of agroup defined by a RadioButtonGroup control.

attribute.name: selectedValue
attribute.description: This will represent the selectedValue chosen for the RadioButtonGroup. It should be used for databinding, so to figure out which radioButton within the same groupNamehas been chosen. Meaning it serves no purpose for display, so rationally you shouldhave databinded to ONE of the RadioButton with the same groupName.

attribute.name: rendered
attribute.description: A boolean value that indicates whether this component should be rendered. Default value: true.

attribute.name: binding
attribute.description: Identifies a backing bean property (of type UIComponent or appropriate subclass) to bind to this component instance. This value must be an EL expression.

attribute.name: componentAttributes
attribute.description: Map of attribute names provided as keys and values provided as values.

attribute.name: componentAttributesJSONFormat
attribute.description: Component attributes provided in JSON Format.

attribute.name: nameSpaceOverride
attribute.description: Component's NameSpace.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: Get a string which uniquely identifies this UIComponent within the scope of the nearest ancestor NamingContainer component. The id is not necessarily unique across all components in the current view.

attribute.name: value
attribute.description: Current value.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: Id of the component.

attribute.name: immediate
attribute.description: A boolean value that identifies the phase during which value change events should fire. During normal event processing, value change events are fired during the "invoke application" phase of request processing. If this attribute is set to true, these methods are fired instead at the end of the apply request values phase.

attribute.name: required
attribute.description: A boolean value that indicates whether an input value is required. If this value is true, and no input value is provided, the error message javax.faces.component.UIInput.REQUIRED is posted.

attribute.name: validator
attribute.description: A method binding EL expression, accepting FacesContext, UIComponent, and Object parameters, and returning void, that validates the component's local value.

attribute.name: valueChangeListener
attribute.description: A method binding EL expression, accepting a ValueChangeEvent parameter and returning void. The specified method is invoked if this component is modified. The phase that this handler is fired in can be controlled via the immediate attribute.

attribute.name: converter
attribute.description: The value can either be a static value (ID) or an EL expression. When a static id is specified, an instance of the converter type registered with that id is used. When this is an EL expression, the result of evaluating the expression must be an object that implements the Converter interface.

attribute.name: converterMessage
attribute.description: Text to be displayed to the user as an error message when conversion of a submitted value to the target type fails.

attribute.name: requiredMessage
attribute.description: Text to be displayed to the user as an error message when this component is marked as "required" but no input data is present during a postback (ie the user left the required field blank).

attribute.name: validatorMessage
attribute.description: Text which will be shown if validation fails.

tag.name: flexObject
tag.description:
This component can have as its direct children components of :
  • AbstractFlexUIObjectListEntries
  • AbstractFlexUIObjectElement
To have nesting of objects, one should have jf:flexObjectElement and
jf:flexObjectListEntries tags as this component's children which have
jf:flexObjectProperty or jf:flexObjectStaticProperty tag for properties.

tag.name: flexObjectElement
tag.description:
Since this component is out of the norm in relation to writing Flex content, it will perform
the write of Flex content within the component rather than within a Renderer [meaning Renderer does
not exist for this component]. Also when stated that it is writing Flex content, it technically is
writing to AbstractFlexUIDataContainerBase's BufferedWriter.
    This component can have following types of children :
  • AbstractFlexUIObjectProperty
  • AbstractFlexUIObjectListEntries

attribute.name: immediate
attribute.description: A boolean value that identifies the phase during which value change events should fire. During normal event processing, value change events are fired during the "invoke application" phase of request processing. If this attribute is set to true, these methods are fired instead at the end of the apply request values phase.

attribute.name: required
attribute.description: A boolean value that indicates whether an input value is required. If this value is true, and no input value is provided, the error message javax.faces.component.UIInput.REQUIRED is posted.

attribute.name: validator
attribute.description: A method binding EL expression, accepting FacesContext, UIComponent, and Object parameters, and returning void, that validates the component's local value.

attribute.name: valueChangeListener
attribute.description: A method binding EL expression, accepting a ValueChangeEvent parameter and returning void. The specified method is invoked if this component is modified. The phase that this handler is fired in can be controlled via the immediate attribute.

attribute.name: converter
attribute.description: The value can either be a static value (ID) or an EL expression. When a static id is specified, an instance of the converter type registered with that id is used. When this is an EL expression, the result of evaluating the expression must be an object that implements the Converter interface.

attribute.name: requiredMessage
attribute.description: Text to be displayed to the user as an error message when this component is marked as "required" but no input data is present during a postback (ie the user left the required field blank).

attribute.name: validatorMessage
attribute.description: Text which will be shown if validation fails.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: Get a string which uniquely identifies this UIComponent within the scope of the nearest ancestor NamingContainer component. The id is not necessarily unique across all components in the current view.

attribute.name: rendered
attribute.description: A boolean value that indicates whether this component should be rendered. Default value: true.

attribute.description: Identifies a backing bean property (of type UIComponent or appropriate subclass) to bind to this component instance. This value must be an EL expression.

tag.name: flexViewStack
tag.description: Since ViewStack is written to maintain it's state, it will extend directly from AbstractUIViewStackBase

attribute.name: componentAttributes
attribute.description: Map of attribute names provided as keys and values provided as values.

attribute.name: componentAttributesJSONFormat
attribute.description: Component attributes provided in JSON Format.

attribute.name: nameSpaceOverride
attribute.description: Component's NameSpace.

attribute.name: selectedIndex
attribute.description: The index in the data provider of the selected item.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: Id of the component.

attribute.name: immediate
attribute.description: A boolean value that identifies the phase during which value change events should fire. During normal event processing, value change events are fired during the "invoke application" phase of request processing. If this attribute is set to true, these methods are fired instead at the end of the apply request values phase.

attribute.name: required
attribute.description: A boolean value that indicates whether an input value is required. If this value is true, and no input value is provided, the error message javax.faces.component.UIInput.REQUIRED is posted.

attribute.name: validator
attribute.description: A method binding EL expression, accepting FacesContext, UIComponent, and Object parameters, and returning void, that validates the component's local value.

attribute.name: valueChangeListener
attribute.description: A method binding EL expression, accepting a ValueChangeEvent parameter and returning void. The specified method is invoked if this component is modified. The phase that this handler is fired in can be controlled via the immediate attribute.

attribute.name: converter
attribute.description: The value can either be a static value (ID) or an EL expression. When a static id is specified, an instance of the converter type registered with that id is used. When this is an EL expression, the result of evaluating the expression must be an object that implements the Converter interface.

attribute.name: converterMessage
attribute.description: Text to be displayed to the user as an error message when conversion of a submitted value to the target type fails.

attribute.name: requiredMessage
attribute.description: Text to be displayed to the user as an error message when this component is marked as "required" but no input data is present during a postback (ie the user left the required field blank).

attribute.name: validatorMessage
attribute.description: Text which will be shown if validation fails.

attribute.name: value
attribute.description: Gets The initial value of this component.

attribute.name: rendered
attribute.description: A boolean value that indicates whether this component should be rendered. Default value: true.

attribute.name: binding
attribute.description: Identifies a backing bean property (of type UIComponent or appropriate subclass) to bind to this component instance. This value must be an EL expression.

tag.name: flexCurrencyFormatter
tag.description:
One thing to note about Flex Formatter and Validator is that they are not actually converters or validators
respectively but actually are components. This is so because they perform the formatting and validation
as Flex components on the client side and not on the server side.

tag.name: flexCreditCardValidator
tag.description:
One thing to note about Flex Formatter and Validator is that they are not actually converters or validators
respectively but actually are components. This is so because they perform the formatting and validation
as Flex components on the client side and not on the server side.
